events.name: GDG Portland-Maine Kickoff Event
events.description:
Where: Innovation Entrance, Room No 31

Agenda: 

5:30 - 6:00: Networking/Food | Presentations start from 6:00pm

Tech Talk by Jennifer Staudenmaier on Google Test Automation Conference :

A survey of topics, trends, and learnings from the 2016 GTAC, an invite-only conference held at the Google Campus in Sunnyvale, CA.

Tech Talk by Terry Tompkins and Brian Nugent on Utilizing Google Cloud Platform for hosting Meteor-based applications: 

Meteor is a full-stack platform for rapidly developing web applications.  Within Customer Facing Software at Idexx, we have been using GCP as a provider for virtual and containerized environments for development, test, and production hosting of Meteor applications.  We will demonstrate the creation and deployment of a simple Meteor application, as well as a brief tour of our first application in production, WebLexicon.  WebLexicon is a web-based application that we use to manage language translation content for our applications.

Pizza and Beverages will be served

events.name: Google Cloud Study Jam, FREE Training (RSVP required)
events.description: Learn the fundamentals of the Google Cloud Platform, how to run containers on it and how to use the platform for data engineering by attending an in-person session for 3 hours. Attendees get free access to the labs ($70+ value). Reserved parking at the Innovation entrance. See the attached flyer for details. Pizza will be served for lunch. Reserve your seat. Space is limited

events.name: CELEBRATING WOMEN TECHMAKERS ON MAY 22
events.description:
IWD Portland-Maine 2018

Speakers:

Belinda Nilsson-Rodrigues - Sr Director of IT Strategy and Portfolio Management
Emilia Bostater - Director of global IT Operations and Architecture from IDEXX Laboratories

All are welcome!

PLEASE RSVP AND FEEL FREE TO SPREAD THE WORD: https://www.linkedin.com/company/gdg-portland-maine/

events.name: Google Community Meet & Greet
events.description: Summer kickoff meet & greet -Google Developers Group is hosting a Google Community meet & greet event. A great way to see what we’re all about and learn about upcoming events.

events.name: Machine Learning Study Jam
events.description:
The GDG Machine Learning Crash Course (MLCC) is intended for those who wish to learn about ML from a practical, applied perspective. For the
full experience, audience members should be comfortable programming,
ideally in Python, and be comfortable with basic algebra. This workshop will give attendees a start on the MLCC materials, which provide an additional 16 hours of self-study exercises. The MLCC is designed to enable you to use machine learning within your everyday projects, and to benefit from the power of TensorFlow wrapped in convenient higher-level abstractions.

Course website: https://g.co/mledu/studyjams

Speaker:

David Steines is an algorithm developer at IDEXX Laboratories. He started using machine learning in graduate school, where he built Brain-Computer Interfaces to control robots and help paralyzed people spell sentences, simply by imagining moving or staring at a grid of flashing letters. Once he was hooked on machine learning, David entered industry and has used machine learning to control robots that are conducting chemistry experiments, and to identify blood cells on laser flow cytometers to diagnose diseases. In his role at IDEXX, he uses Tensorflow and machine learning to build cutting-edge diagnostic algorithms for the veterinary industry, including looking for crystals and other objects in urine sediment image, or identifying diseases in x-rays. He is thrilled to share his experiences with the Portland Google Developer Group!

Facilitators:

Clare Bates Congdon is Senior Research Scientist at Introspective Systems. She has been working in Machine Learning for over 25 years, and teaching Computer Science for over 20 years. Her expertise includes machine learning, artificial intelligence, genetic algorithms, and complex adaptive systems. Her work in machine learning and bioinformatics has been funded by both the National Science Foundation and the National Institutes of Health. Her work in intelligent agents and games has won four international competitions. She is active in international professional organizations, and has been Chair of the IEEE CIS Technical Committee on Bioinformatics and Bioengineering, and Vice Chair of the IEEE CIS Technical Committee on Games. Congdon holds a BA in Mathematics from Wesleyan University and an MS and PhD in Computer Science and Engineering from the University of Michigan.

Carleton Ericson has worked at IDEXX since 2013 and is finishing up his MS in computer science this fall from Georgia Tech (specializing in machine learning), where he also was a teaching assistant for the Computer Vision class. He has applied machine learning to many computer vision problems, including microscopic cell identification and automated reading of SNAP test results.

Kevin Hanselman has been a Software Engineer at IDEXX for five years. Also enrolled in Georgia Tech's OMSCS program, he is finishing up his master's degree in Computer Science with a specialization in machine learning. Between school and work, Kevin has applied machine learning to a variety of domains, including stock trading, object tracking in video, autonomous path-finding, semantic image segmentation, and predicting clinical results from medical imaging.

Note: RSVP required.

events.name: GDG Holiday Event
events.description:
Let's Jingle and Mingle!
The most exciting time of the year has come: Holiday Parties & Gifts. It's time to celebrate 2018! We want to thank everyone for a great year.
Please join us for lots of cheer.
events.how_to_find_us: When you arrive head to the Compass room located in the back of the restaurant

events.name: GDG DevFest - Portland Maine
events.description:
DevFests are the largest community-run Google events in the world!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CKvi3sT3gU8&index=10&list=PL1blf2lcaPMSboE_A-UZ0C-gNU-l_4AEE

Please join us for our first Portland Maine #DevFest18. Enjoy lightning talks from our own community, speeches from Google experts, and learn hands-on with Google Cloud Qwiklabs (bring your laptop if you plan to participate in the qwiklab)!

DevFests book up quickly! RSVP to let us know you'll be joining us.

Light Breakfast items, lunch and swag will be provided.

Current Lineup:

9:00am-9:30am- Check-in
9:30am-9:45am- Introduction- What is GDG/DevFest?
9:45am-10:15am- Jason Judd 'How Educate Maine is Impacting K-12'
10:15am-11:00am- Eva Sofianos 'Nailing the Tech Interview'
11am-11:45am- Amal Hussein 'Welcome to your Wonderful Web Platform'

11:45am-12:30pm- Lunch located in Synergy/Fusion Cafe

12:30pm-1:15pm- Jinn Kim 'Learn about Firebase ML Kit & Some of the Technology Powering It'
1:15pm-2:15pm- QwikLab 'Kubernetes in the Cloud'
events.how_to_find_us: Entrance located in the front of the Innovations building
